title: Doctoral student in Physics with specialization in experimental particle physics
description:
Lund University was founded in 1666 and is repeatedly ranked among the world’s top universities. The University has around 47 000 students and more than 8 800 staff based in Lund, Helsingborg and Malmö. We are united in our efforts to understand, explain and improve our world and the human condition. Lund University welcomes applicants with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We regard gender equality and diversity as a strength and an asset.

  

The LDMX group at Lund University seeks a skilled and motivated doctoral student to participate in our efforts to get LDMX online and make the most of its data.


This doctoral student position will be part of the Lund LDMX group (LunDMX, https://www.particle-nuclear.lu.se/experimental-particle-and-nuclear-physics/ldmx ), embedded in the division for particle and nuclear physics (https://www.particle-nuclear.lu.se/) at the physics department. The division with about 60 employees comprises a lively mixture of active research in theoretical and experimental particle, and heavy ion physics, and experimental nuclear physics. The experimental particle physics activities include research at the well-established LHC experiments ATLAS and ALICE as well as efforts to realise new, creative experiments like HIBEAM/NNBAR at ESS and – the focus of this project – LDMX at SLAC (https://confluence.slac.stanford.edu/display/MME/Light+Dark+Matter+Experiment). LDMX will be a fixed-target experiment in an 8 GeV electron beam extracted from the upgraded LCLC-II accelerator. Its main objective is to conclusively test models of sub-GeV thermal-relic dark matter over several orders of magnitude in mass range. Within the division, we exploit synergies across these different projects, and our contributions include detector development, trigger and DAQ, physics and performance analysis as well as software development and computing. The LunDMX group currently consists of a senior researcher, three faculty members, a postdoc, an engineer, and two Ph.D. students.

**Project description**
-----------------------


The overarching theme of this project is to get ready for LDMX data (expected during 2029). The work will be conducted in close connection with the international LDMX collaboration, in which Lund University is currently the only non-US participant.


One exciting milestone for LDMX is a beam test at SLAC in the autumn of 2025, for the first time collecting data at the actual beam line for LDMX, which will be operated parasitically to the photon science conducted with LCLS-II. In addition, we plan to collect cosmics data with a prototype of the hadronic calorimeter. During the first 1-2 years, roughly, this project will be focused on the gathering and, in particular, on the analysis of these test measurements and on publishing the results.


Another priority in this project will be to study the capabilities of LDMX to handle pile-up (multiple electrons hitting the target at the same time) in more detail. This will mainly be based on simulation-studies of potential backgrounds, detector performance, and physics sensitivities. One concrete example is the use of different codes for simulating critical backgrounds, comparing their predictions and developing methods for how to measure these backgrounds in data. The project also aims to explore to which extent machine learning methods can help with these tasks, e.g. object reconstruction and signal vs background discrimination. This will become more of a focus later in the project.  

Beyond the direct physics questions, the project will also engage with questions of climate sustainability in LDMX/HEP, for instance by identifying the main emission sources and investigating how to minimize the related emissions.

**Work tasks and duties**
-------------------------


The main duties of doctoral students are to devote themselves to their research studies, which include participating in research projects and third-cycle courses. The work duties can also include teaching and other departmental duties (no more than 20%).


As a doctoral student in the LunDMX group, you will contribute to the data analysis of the test measurements performed with different detector prototypes.


Beyond that, you will perform simulation-based studies of different aspects feeding into the physics potential of LDMX. This will require the use (and further development) of different simulation tools, mainly the GEANT4-based ldmx-sw framework (https://github.com/LDMX-Software/ldmx-sw ), written in C++, maintained on github and configured via python.


You will work with .root files and explore different event generators as well as machine learning tools and algorithms.


The nature of LDMX as an international project will require you to work collaboratively in an international research environment.


Your main place of work will be at the Physics Department in Lund, but trips to SLAC/our collaborators may also become necessary.


The position requires clear and thoughtful communication, both within the scientific community and with the public.


You will contribute to the development and maintenance of the common LDMX software.


You will be responsible for documentation and reporting of your research activities, maintaining detailed records of your work, preparing documentation for future users and following the LDMX requirements for contributing to documentation.


You are expected to participate in mentorship and training of students, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment.


You will be given the opportunity to seek external research funding for travel or small projects.


Your tasks will also include taking care of administration related to the duties outlined above.

**Entry requirements**
----------------------

**Admission requirements**
--------------------------


A person meets the general admission requirements for third-cycle courses and study programmes if he or she:

* has been awarded a second-cycle qualification, or
* has satisfied the requirements for courses comprising at least 240 credits of which at least 60 credits were awarded in the second cycle, or
* has acquired substantially equivalent knowledge in some other way in Sweden or abroad.


A person meets the specific admission requirements for third-cycle studies in Physics if he or she has:

* independent project (e.g.degree project) of at least 30 credits in a relevant subject


Equivalent knowledge acquired through corresponding programmes will be assessed individually. In order to enable interdisciplinary initiatives and important specializations in certain areas, students with qualifications in subjects other than Physics may be considered for admission.


Finally, the student must be judged to have the potential to complete the programme.


Additional requirements:

* Very good oral and written proficiency in English.
* Collaborative skills in order to work in an international collaboration
* Prior experience at least at a basic level in programming in C++ and/or Python

**Other assessment criteria**
-----------------------------


Below follows a list of qualifications that should be read as “and/or”, not “and” – if you fulfil any of the listed requirements, it is a plus, but we do not expect you to tick all the boxes simultaneously.

* Prior experience in experimental particle physics and data analysis
* Prior experience with machine learning tools
* Prior experience in developing algorithms such as particle identification, specific final state event selection, or object reconstruction
* Interest in student supervision (bachelor, master)
* Prior experience in environmental sustainability

**Basis of assessment**
-----------------------


Selection to postgraduate studies is based on the expected ability to perform well in the studies. The evaluation of the ability to perform well is based primarily on the results of studies at the basic and advanced levels, in particular:

* Knowledge and skills relevant to the thesis project and the subject of the study.
* An assessment of ability to work independently and to formulate and tackle research problems.
* Written and oral communication skills
* Other experience relevant to postgraduate studies, such as professional experience.


Consideration will also be given to good collaborative skills, drive and independence, and how the applicant, through his or her experience and skills, is deemed to have the abilities necessary for successfully completing the third cycle programme.

**Terms of employment**
-----------------------


Only those admitted to third cycle studies may be appointed to a doctoral studentship. Third cycle studies at LTH consist of full-time studies for 4 years. A doctoral studentship is a fixed-term employment of a maximum of 5 years (including 20% departmental duties). Doctoral studentships are regulated in the Higher Education Ordinance (1993:100), chapter 5, 1-7 §§.

**Instructions on how to apply**
--------------------------------


Applications are to be submitted via the University’s online recruitment system. Applications shall be written in English.  

Applications shall include:

* a 1-page cover letter stating the reasons why you are interested in the position and in what way the research project corresponds to your interests and educational background.
* a CV
* a degree certificate or equivalent (if the degree is not completed yet, please provide or short note from your programme supporting your projected graduation date, or something equivalent)
* a copy of your thesis or equivalent (alternatively a summary in case the thesis is not yet completed)
* contact information for at least two references
* other documents you wish to be considered (e.g. grade transcripts)


As part of the application process, you will be asked to answer a few questions in the recruitment system.  

Applicants that are called for an interview might be asked to provide a work sample or to complete a knowledge test.  

If need be, there will be more than one round of interviews.


Most welcome to apply!


Within the Faculty of Science research and education is conducted within Biology, Astronomy, Physics, Geosciences, Chemistry, Mathematics and Environmental Sciences. The Faculty of Science is organized into eight departments, gathered in the northern campus area in Lund. The Faculty of Science has approximately 1500 students, 360 PhD students and 700 employees.


The Department of Physics is one of Lund University's largest departments with approximately 400 employees. The department is shared between the Faculty of Science and Faculty of Engineering. At the department there are seven research divisions and a number of major research centra. The research at the department covers a wide range of modern physics.
  

www.fysik.lu.se/en/  




We kindly decline all sales and marketing contacts.

Last day to apply is **5th October 2025.** We look forward to reading your application in PDF format.

title: FACTS and HVDC System Studies Specialist
description:
**Company Description**  

AFRY provides engineering, design, digital and advisory services. We are devoted experts in industry, energy and infrastructure sectors, creating impact for generations to come. AFRY has Nordic roots with a global reach. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable society.

 **Job Description**  

We, within our competence and expertise, at AFRY are involved in shaping the future of the energy transition. The Transmission & Distribution (T&D) business area's strategy addresses the challenges of a changing power sector, upgraded grid infrastructures are instrumental in adopting the future generation mix to guarantee an economic and reliable power supply.


Advanced Power Systems & Solutions is a vibrant team, part of the System Studies and HVDC section within T&D Sweden at AFRY. The team has a cross-functional role with a focus on FACTS (Flexible Alternating Current Transmission Systems), HVDC (High-Voltage, Direct Current) transmission system, Integration of Renewables, and other Advanced Power System Applications within Sweden, and Internationally. At present, the system studies and HVDC section consists teams within seven offices across Sweden.


Integration of renewable energy along with FACTS and HVDC play a vital role in the development of sustainable transmission and distribution systems for now and the future. There is a growing need for advanced FACTS and HVDC systems around the world. Renewable electricity generation and demand continue to grow and the vision of higher penetration of Power Electronic Interfaced Generation will continue beyond 2030. We have the business mind of Making Future.


We develop the system requirements for different utility and industry customers’ needs and also evaluate contractors and supplier submittals for both tenders and projects. You should be able to develop systems and solutions based on those system and functional requirements. We work together with our customers towards delivering sustainable techno-economic solutions in a timely manner is a core value for the team.

 **Qualifications**  

You are experienced within the power systems analysis field and have MSc or PhD in the field of electrical power systems with **at least 5 years** of hands-on experience in this field. You are passionate about working with new and leading technologies and have a good knowledge of FACTS and HVDC systems.


You have the knowledge and proven experience in simulation programs and power system tools.


You must demonstrate excellent command in at least two of the following software programs and tools, PSCAD, PSS/E, DIgSILENT / PowerFactory, EMTP-RV, ETAP, MATLAB, Simulink, RSCAD / RTDS ...etc. Experience in CIM/CGMES is a plus.


Being able to demonstrate a very good understanding of FACTS and/or HVDC systems within some of the following areas brings value to our offering and will be assessed during the application process:

* Dynamic performance optimization of the converter controls (e.g. grid forming and grid following control, black-start and network restoration, multi-terminal operation).
* Harmonic Impedance Scans
* Subsynchronous Resonance
* Sub-synchronous Torsional Interactions
* Control System Interaction
* Control System Design
* Network models developments, benchmarking, and validation
* Feasibility Studies and optimal allocation of plants
* Selectivity study of a power system
* Dynamic Performance Studies
* Insulation Coordination Studies
* Power Quality Studies (Harmonic Performance, Flicker, ...etc)
* System Interaction Studies and Resonance
* AC & DC Network Integration
* RTDS Simulation


To succeed in the role, you need your social and analytical skills, you are expected to be communicative with a powerful self-drive, results oriented and able to work independently in both AFRY premises and also at our customers. This means that you will be given opportunities to travel and commute within Sweden in part but also you can expect to have the opportunity to work with some customers overseas.


We want a colleague that is business oriented and understand the sales and marketing business as part of being a consultant and hence you should be able to develop and drive credible and productive long-term relations with our customers and expand your business network.


Fluent communication in English and good command of Swedish are required for this position. Good knowledge of other languages is a plus.

 **Additional Information**  

In this recruitment process, we are handling your applications ongoing.  

This means that the position may be filled before the advertising time has expired.  

Therefore it is a good idea to **submit your application as soon as possible, the expiring date is the 20th of September.**


If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact the responsible recruitment partner Maria Hansson, maria.hansson@afry.com, or the recruiting manager Mustafa Ibrahim, mustafa.ibrahim@afry.com


We are looking forward to your application!

*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*
company_addresses:
Our headquarters are in Stockholm, Sweden yet our businesses and clients extend right across the globe. 

Frösundaleden 2
SE 169 70, Stockholm

info@afry.com
+46105050000

title: Backend C# .Net
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Vi söker dig som vill vara del i helhetslösningen som kopplar samman slutanvändaren och hårdvaran. Teamet du kommer tillhöra utvecklar ett VMS som kodas i C#.



Vi söker dig som

title: Verification Engineer
description:
Welcome to Husqvarna - one of the world’s oldest start-ups!
Curious by nature. Constantly on the lookout for new territories to explore. And new ways to experience the world around us. We have gone from solving people's everyday problems to shaping great experiences. We are a creative hub for innovative and passionate minds. Together, we are on a mission—to shape greater experiences than ever before and revolutionize the way we take care of our products and customers. And now, we want you to be a part of it.
At the Product Lab (Residential) for robotic lawn mowers, we are seeking a solution-oriented engineer with a strong passion for product development, investigative work, and testing.
At the Product Lab, we conduct tests on both newly developed products and mowers that are in production.
About the Role  

As a Test Engineer, you will perform tests on components and complete products to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements as well as Husqvarna’s internal standards. Testing is carried out using various equipment and rigs, as well as in real-world conditions on dedicated grass surfaces.
A key part of the role is to clearly communicate the results, both verbally and through written reports.
Mechanical testing of robotic lawn mowers, software handling, and development of test methods are all part of the position.
About you  

You have a solid interest in the following areas:* Technology (mechanics, electronics)
* Investigative work
* Problem-solving
* Practical and theoretical work


We see it as a strong plus if you have knowledge or interest in one or more of the following areas:* Experience in design and/or lab work
* Mechanical processing (turning, milling)


To thrive in this role we also see that you have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in engineering (specialization in mechanics or electronics)
Your profile  

You are technically skilled and curious, both theoretically and practically, preferably within electronics and mechanics. You have relevant experience in these areas. You enjoy both theory and hands-on work, and you thrive on solving problems. You are committed, enjoy challenges, and are comfortable with many points of contact both within and outside the company.
You have a background or genuine interest in:* Technology
* Working both theoretically and practically
* Being a team player with a strong drive to realize projects. Social competence is important.
* Good understanding of physical principles and the ability to see connections between things
* Structure and organization
* Sharing knowledge and discussing solutions
* Viewing systems from the end-user’s perspective and having the curiosity and ability to understand how systems are used


To succeed in this role, we believe you are curious about Husqvarna’s products and how they are built and function. You also have a strong respect for safety when working with the products.
Travel within and outside Sweden may occur. You are fluent in both Swedish and English and speak Swedish effortlessly.
Your application
If this sounds like you, don’t wait—apply as soon as possible! Selection is ongoing. Note: We do not accept applications via email due to GDPR compliance.
For more questions regarding the position please contact:
Hiring Manager: Joakim Arvby, joakim.arvby@husqvarnagroup.com
For more information about the recruitment process, please contact:
Recruiter: Jonathan Olsson, jonathan.olsson@husqvarnagroup.com
Winning Through Culture
We believe that business is ultimately about people, as a team, we win and grow together. Our culture is built on bold ideas, strong commitment, and a shared purpose, creating an environment where innovation thrives, people grow, and every contribution matters.
Our culture is built on three core themes:* Bold: We push boundaries, embrace challenges, and explore new possibilities.
* Dedicated: We put in the hard work, bring passion and resilience to every challenge we take on.
* Care: We support each other, consider the impact of our actions, and strive to make a lasting difference.


Whether you’re starting your career or looking for the next big step, we offer a place where passion and purpose come together. Join us in shaping the future!
Learn more about our culture *here*.
Last date to apply:
25 September 2025

title: QA /Test Engineer på Sigma Technology
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Sigma Technology North Solutions AB** fortsätter digitalisera Norrland, därför söker vi nu dig som vill vara med på vår resa – den här gången som **QA/Test Engineer**



Som anställd hos oss på Sigma Technology erbjuds du en trygg anställning där du uppmuntras att påverka din karriärväg genom agila utvecklingsmetoder. Du kommer att arbeta i en internationell miljö med medarbetare från hela världen. Tack vare vårt stora kundnätverk inom olika branscher och områden, finns det alltid nya utmaningar att ta sig an!



**Vilken blir din nästa utmaning?**



Vi sätter dig som konsult i fokus. Det viktigaste för oss är att du som konsult och medarbetare mår bra och har rätt förutsättningar för att utvecklas. Vi tror på långsiktighet och vill därför att du ska trivas hos oss, länge!



Vi på Sigma Technology är otroligt stolta över att våra medarbetare röstat fram oss som topp-3 Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare i flera år i rad.


Vi värdesätter gemenskap och uppmuntrar till sociala aktiviteter, teambuilding och utbildningar för att tillsammans skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi ska trivas och växa. Intern kompetensöverföring ser vi som en självklarhet – kanske vill du själv dela med dig av ett eget intresseområde eller ny teknik?



Vår vision är att sprida vår kunskap för att hjälpa skapa en mer inkluderande digital värld. Det genomsyrar allt vi gör, liksom våra värderingar: jämställdhet, hållbarhet och tillgänglighet.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



**Dina ansvarsområden**



- Förbereda, genomföra och dokumentera testning av mjukvaru- och hårdvarukomponenter (både manuella och automatiserade tester).  

* Automatisera återkommande testfall i testskriptverktyg (inklusive API-testning).
* Utföra funktionella och icke-funktionella tester baserat på krav och definierade användningsscenarion.
* Delta i granskning av testplaner, krav, testdesign och implementationer av testfall.
* Rapportera identifierade defekter och verifiera att levererade kodfixar har eliminerat grundorsaken.
* Stödja utvecklingsteam och professionella serviceteam med analys av identifierade programvarufel och potentiella problemområden.


- Genomföra kund- eller marknadsdrivna testaktiviteter, exempelvis prestanda- och kapacitetstester eller verifiering av systemdrift under specifika förhållanden.  

* Analysera resultat av testkörningar och sammanställa rapporter.
* Designa och implementera testramverk och integrera dessa i testmiljön.
* Utforska och utvärdera nya testtekniker och teknologier.
* Underhålla och förbättra testverktyg, ramverk och utrustning i QA-labbet.

### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



**Du som brinner för kvalitet och testning av avancerade system där tekniken ligger i framkant kommer att trivas på Sigma Technology**



Som person är du analytisk, prestigelös och har en god kommunikativ förmåga. Du tycker om att samarbeta men kan också ta egna initiativ och arbeta självständigt. Du är engagerad, lösningsorienterad och strävar ständigt efter förbättring.



**Basic qualifications:**



- En examen inom data- eller systemvetenskap eller motsvarande.  

* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av testning av mjukvara eller system.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av Linux/Unix och Windows.
* Vana av programmering/scripting, t.ex. C, Python, Perl eller PHP.
* Erfarenhet av testautomation, API-tester och funktionella/icke-funktionella tester.
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på engelska.


**Technical skills:**



* Erfarenhet av skriptspråk (såsom PHP, Python, Perl, Tcl).
* Erfarenhet av TCP/IP-baserad nätverkskommunikation.
* Erfarenhet av IP-säkerhet är en stark merit.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i Linux/Unix-miljö.
* Erfarenhet av programmeringsspråk (såsom C, C++, .NET, Java) är värdefullt.
* Erfarenhet av databashantering (såsom SQL, MySQL, SQLite).
* Erfarenhet av webteknologier, webbtjänster och browserbaserad mjukvara.
* Erfarenhet av GUI-automationsverktyg (såsom Ranorex, TestComplete) ses som meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av agila utvecklingsmetoder är en fördel (t.ex. SCRUM).



### **WE OFFER**



**Sigma Technology: Innovation och personlig utveckling i fokus**



Hos oss strävar vi inte bara efter innovation; vi sätter också dig i centrum. Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsplats med omfattande möjligheter till personlig och professionell utveckling.



Våra kontorslokaler är av högsta klass och vi erbjuder attraktiva förmåner som bonusprogram, gemensamma Summit-träffar, After Work-evenemang, subventionerade luncher och aktiviteter som främjar hälsa.



Vi tror på att bygga långsiktiga relationer och vill att du ska trivas och växa hos oss över tid. Som konsult hos Sigma Technology får du arbeta med spännande projekt och bygga ett omfattande nätverk både internt och externt. Att du trivs på jobbet och att vi har kul tillsammans är grundläggande.



Vår vision, "Expect a better tomorrow", genomsyrar allt vi gör - från vår dagliga verksamhet till vårt engagemang för hållbarhet. Sigma Technology är aktivt engagerade i initiativ som Star for Life och Mentorprogram. Lär dig mer om vårt arbete och våra värderingar på www.sigmatechnology .com .



Med oss kan du förverkliga dina ambitioner och ha roligt längs vägen!

title: AI/ML Engineer
description:
AI/ML Engineer


Swedium Global is looking for **AI/ML Engineer**


We are looking for experienced software developer with a passion for artificial intelligence and scalable agent platforms, also thrive in fast-paced environments where innovation and impact go hand in hand. XX is on a mission to transform the way we build intelligent systems.


We're looking for **talented AI/ML Engineers** to join our growing team and help shape the future of our AI Automation Platform. This is a unique opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies that drive automation, intelligence, and scalability across our global operations.


**Roles & Responsibilities:**


* Build an automation platform which is scalable for all the AI use cases.
* Design, develop, and deploy scalable AI-driven solutions and agent-based systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data engineers, architects, and platform engineers.
* Contribute to the evolution of our AI automation platform, ensuring robustness, performance, and maintainability.
* Explore and implement state-of-the-art techniques in machine learning, reinforcement learning, and multi-agent systems.
* Participate in architectural decisions and help define best practices for AI engineering across the organization.
* Implement and manage Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to enable persistent, context-aware agent behaviour across workflows.


**Your Qualification and Experience:**


* Proven experience in software development, Machine learning ideally with a focus on AI, automation, or intelligent agents.
* Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages. Experience with automation tools such as n8n, Workato, or similar platforms.
* Familiarity with LLMs (eg, GPT, Claude, Gemini) and frameworks for agent orchestration such as LangChain, Vextex AI Agent Builder, or Open Agents.
* Hands-on experience with vibe-coding, prompt engineering, and designing agent workflows. Understanding of scalable system design and distributed computing.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a collaborative mindset.


**Good to have:**


* Experience with agent-based modelling, reinforcement learning, or orchestration platforms.

  
Job Overview


* Location : Stockholm, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : AI, ML, LLM, Python, Automation, Developer

title: ML/AI Engineer
description:
**About Hubexo:**


We provide cutting-edge data, insights, and software solutions to the global construction industry. We specialize in project information, eTendering, product information, market intelligence, and specification. We help the world build better by delivering unrivalled insights and technology that shape places where people live, work and play.

**The team:**


We have several development hubs worldwide, and this position concerns our AI Hub in Stockholm with a team of 6 AI engineers and data scientists. You will report directly to the VP Product Technology.


The team shapes its own processes and will work with agile development methods.

**The role:**


As an ML/AI Engineer, you will automate information collection and data flows, fine-tune LLMs, perform prompt engineering, and work with Machine Learning.


At present, we sell data with great potential for further refinement, and your role will be central in building systems all the way into production. You will be an important part of the team helping us reduce costs for data collection and create the conditions for better user experiences, which in turn leads to more satisfied customers.


You will be a key player in one of our most important initiatives right now.

**Our technology:**


We see programming as a craft that can be applied across different programming languages and platforms. Our current product stack mainly includes Node.js, React, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, and AWS. In this AI/ML role, we are free to choose technologies, and we expect the main focus to be on LLMs, neural networks, and Python.


Together with the team, you will build your own library. We are looking for someone with a broad skill set; we strive to be at the forefront of technology, and we expect the right candidate to have a strong technical interest and quickly learn the latest advancements.

**About you:**


You have a strong interest in technology and want to be at the forefront with the latest developments. You follow the AI revolution closely and are not afraid to test new techniques and methods. You hold an engineering degree from a university or college and have most likely developed projects alongside your studies or work.


You have 2–5 years of professional experience, and we value if you have previously been involved in deploying AI/ML into production environments.

**Why Hubexo:**


Competitive salary  

Occupational pension (ITP1)  

30 days of vacation

title: FPGA Verification Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Are you passionate about driving innovation and working on groundbreaking 5G and 6G mobile communication solutions? Do you thrive in a flexible working culture, where new insights are championed, and you are encouraged to develop new skills?  

  

We are looking for an FPGA Verifier to join the Ericsson Silicon organization. You will work with dedicated engineers who are passionate about developing world-class Radio and RAN Compute products. You will play a key role in the FPGA team—defining verification strategies and implementing environments for high-efficiency data transfer and processing with embedded subsystems. As part of our global organization, you'll collaborate with talented teams across our various sites. We are committed to Agile principles, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment that encourages creativity and teamwork

 **What you will do:**

  

* Define verification requirements and strategies for FPGA designs based on functional specifications and Ericsson development processes.
* Implement verification environments and test cases to execute verification plans.
* Measure functional and code coverage metrics, driving towards completion targets.
* Collaborate with hardware, software, systems, and integration teams to understand overall product requirements and drive efficient solutions.
* Analyze simulation results, debug issues, and collaborate with design teams for resolution.
* Create, maintain and enhance regression suites and verification environments.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of products, tools, and processes.
* Participate in test plan, test case, code review and ensure high standards.
* Generate appropriate documentation.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* 3+ years of experience in FPGA/ASIC verification.
* A track record of successful verification of standard/custom IP blocks.
* Strong expertise in verification methodologies such as UVM/ OVM.
* Proficiency in SystemVerilog/ Verilog.
* Ability to understand, reuse existing test benches effectively and/or write reusable, modular and well documented UVM test benches verification.
* Experience with simulation and verification tools Xcelium, VCS, QuestaSim.
* Experience with waveform viewers, debugging techniques and coverage-driven verification.
* Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Tcl, shell scripting, etc.
* Understanding/project experience in communication protocols Ex: PCIe, Ethernet, DDR, SPI, I2C, I3C, AXI, APB.
* Strong knowledge of digital design fundamentals, timing, clock domain crossing.
* Experience in version control GIT, ClearCase.
* An analytical approach and results-oriented mindset with the ability to deliver under pressure.
* High self-motivation and the ability to work independently while being a great teammate.
* A track record of successful cross-team and cross-site collaboration.
* Excellent English verbal and written communication skills
* Master degree in Electronics or Computer Engineering or equivalent.

 **Nice to have:**

* Ability to architect and create UVM/RTL testbenches from scratch.
* Familiarity with modern FPGA device families and tools.
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**📊 Data & Analytics Engineer - Stockholm (Hybrid)** 




  





*Shape the future of data-driven decision-making in a modernising enterprise* 




  





 A well-established Swedish company is undergoing a major digital transformation and is looking for a
 **Data & Analytics Engineer** 
 to help build and optimise its new cloud-based data platform. This is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-impact team at the early stages of a long-term data modernisation journey.
 



  





 You’ll work across the full data lifecycle - from ingestion and modelling to orchestration and reporting - using modern tools like DBT, Power BI, and Azure Data Factory. The role blends elements of analytics engineering, BI development, and data pipeline optimisation, offering broad exposure and real ownership.
 



  





 🧠 What You’ll Do
 


* Own and evolve the company’s DBT-based data models, supporting business-critical reporting and analytics
* Build and maintain Power BI dashboards that deliver actionable insights to stakeholders
* Collaborate with business users to understand data needs and translate them into scalable models
* Orchestrate and monitor data pipelines using Azure Data Factory
* Optimise Snowflake usage and cost, and contribute to performance tuning
* Support legacy SQL Server-based data flows and help plan their gradual migration to the cloud
* Work closely with a small team to shape the company’s modern BI architecture



  





 🛠 Tech Stack
 


* **Core** 
 : SQL, DBT, Power BI, Snowflake
* **Cloud & Orchestration** 
 : Azure, Azure Data Factory, Blob Storage
* **Other** 
 : Python (for light scripting), Git, Medallion architecture (Bronze/Silver/Gold)



  





 🎯 What We’re Looking For
 


* Strong SQL skills and experience with data modelling and transformation
* Familiarity with DBT or a strong interest in learning it
* Experience building reports in Power BI or similar tools
* Understanding of data orchestration and pipeline monitoring (e.g., ADF, Airflow)
* Ability to work across both backend and frontend data layers
* Interest in staying up to date with new features and best practices in the data ecosystem
* Swedish language proficiency is required due to stakeholder interaction and on-call responsibilities



  





 💼 Role Details
 


* **Location** 
 : Sollentuna, Stockholm (50/50 hybrid)
* **Benefits** 
 : Competitive salary, Union agreement, pension, wellness allowance, and more
* **Team** 
 : You’ll work alongside a small but growing data team, with lots of room to shape processes and tooling



  





 🚀 Why This Role?
 


* Join a company at the start of a major cloud and data transformation
* Work with modern tools and architectures in a greenfield environment
* Take ownership of key systems and influence long-term strategy
* Be part of a stable, profitable business with a strong customer base and ambitious tech leadership

title: Research assistant with technical background
emails: marie.lof@ki.se, marie.lof@ki.se, karin.gase@ki.se, karin.gase@ki.se, Peter.Svensson@ki.se, Peter.Svensson@ki.se, elizabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, elizabeth.valenzuela@ki.se, mari.gilljam@ki.se, mari.gilljam@ki.se
description:
**Do you want to contribute to better health for all?**
 The IMPACT research group – Marie Löf, Department of Medicine, Huddinge, Karolinska Institutet, consists of 30 people and includes both senior and junior researchers, postdoctoral fellows, and doctoral students. The research group has more than ten years of experience in developing digital lifestyle interventions (diet and physical activity) for primary and secondary prevention of obesity and lifestyle-related diseases in children and adults that can be delivered by healthcare. The group also leads several Swedish data collections in large international studies. Professor Löf is also coordinator of the newly started multidisciplinary research centre Centre for Nutrition.
   

  

**Your mission**
 We are looking for one research assistant for a fixed-term position of one year. The work involves developing a system that delivers digital interventions. It includes applications for smartphones (both Android and iOS operating systems) as well as a server-side component which includes a web-interface for clinicians and clinical experts, a database, an analytics engine, and other supporting components. The work will be conducted in premises. The position suits a junior person with an interest in research. The research assistant will be part of Professor Marie Löf's research group IMPACT at Karolinska Institutet.
   

  

**Your profile**
**Required Qualifications**
* Degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering (or equivalent)
* Excellent knowledge in programming fundamentals and object-oriented programming
* Excellent knowledge in the Linux operating system
* Excellent knowledge in relational databases
* Excellent knowledge of English


**Optional Qualifications**
* Excellent knowledge in software design
* Experience in developing applications for Android
* Experience in developing applications for iOS
* Experience in developing applications in Flutter
* Experience in developing web applications
* Experience in the following tools: docker, tomcat, nginx, SQL, MongoDB
* Experience in the following programming languages: Java, python
* Experience in computer networks
* Knowledge/interest in nutrition, nursing, physiotherapy, or medicine
* Knowledge of Swedish


**What do we offer?**
 A creative and inspiring environment with wide-ranging expertise and interests. Karolinska Institutet is one of the world's leading medical universities. Our vision is to pursue the development of knowledge about life and to promote a better health for all. At Karolinska Institutet, we conduct successful medical research and hold the largest range of medical education in Sweden. Karolinska Institutet is also a state university, which entitles you to several good benefits through our collective agreement. And you get to practice freely in our modern wellness facilities, where trained staff are on site.
   

  

****Location:****
 Flemingsberg
   

  

*The IMPACT research group – Marie Löf | Karolinska Institutet*
*Choose to work at KI – Ten reasons why*
**Application**
 Welcome to apply at the latest 19 September 2025.
   

  

 The application is to be submitted through the Varbi recruitment system.In this recruitment, you will apply with your CV without a personal letter. Instead, you will answer some questions about why you are applying for the job in the application form.
   

  

**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all**

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**🌱 Senior Data Engineer - AWS | Stockholm (Sweden) or Bergen (Norway)** 




  





*Build the data backbone for a smarter, more sustainable future#* 




  





 A pioneering tech company in the sustainability space is building a next-generation decision support platform powered by real-time signals and predictive modelling. They’re looking for a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 to lead the development of scalable, high-quality data infrastructure that powers intelligent insights across operations.
 



  





 This is a
 **senior-level role** 
 with real ownership. You’ll be shaping the architecture, tooling, and data strategy from the ground up - turning raw sensor and operational data into actionable intelligence used by customers every day.
 



  





 🧠 What You’ll Do
 


* Build and own a new data service that ingests, stores, and transforms external and internal data streams
* Design and maintain unified, time-aligned data models combining real-time signals with operational context
* Develop robust REST APIs to serve predictions and optimisation results to internal apps and external partners
* Implement automated data validation, lineage tracking, and observability at scale
* Choose the right tools for streaming vs batch workloads, balancing performance and cost
* Ensure secure, compliant data handling with access controls and audit trails
* Collaborate with product, ML, optimisation, and customer success teams to deliver measurable impact



  





 🛠 Tech Stack
 


* **Languages** 
 : Python (FastAPI, Pydantic), SQL
* **Databases** 
 : PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB or similar
* **Cloud & Storage** 
 : AWS, S3-style object storage
* **Infrastructure** 
 : Docker, GitHub Actions, CI/CD pipelines



  





 🎯 What We’re Looking For
 


* Strong Python engineering skills and experience building production-grade data pipelines
* Proven ability to design, ship, and maintain scalable data systems
* Experience with testing frameworks (pytest, fixtures), code reviews, and CI/CD
* Familiarity with time-series data, sensor fusion, or industrial data is a plus
* Exposure to ML feature engineering or optimisation/OR is a bonus
* A collaborative mindset and enthusiasm for working across teams



  





 💼 Role Details
 


* **Location** 
 : Stockholm (Remote-friendly with flexible hours)
* **Salary** 
 : Competitive
* **Benefits** 
 : Strong insurance, relocation support, and generous time off
* **Impact** 
 : Your work will directly support sustainable operations across multiple regions including Scandinavia, Canada, and Australia



  





 🚀 What Success Looks Like (First 6–12 Months)
 


* Production-grade ingest for multiple data sources with automated QA and alerting
* Unified schema supporting predictive models and optimisation workflows
* Stable, observable APIs with clear lineage and reproducibility
* Real-world validation of data signals against operational outcomes



  





 🌟 Why This Role Matters
 



 This is a rare opportunity to
 **shape a category-defining platform** 
 at the intersection of real-time sensing and predictive planning. You’ll be joining a small, high-leverage team where your decisions and code directly influence how customers operate more sustainably and efficiently.

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about building scalable ML infrastructure and enabling advanced analytics? ICA Sverige is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join our Data Science & AI team in Solna.
   

  

**About The Role As Senior Machine Learning Engineer**
 As a senior engineer, you will take technical ownership of our ML infrastructure and play a key role in enabling ICA’s AI capabilities. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team working closely with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to build and maintain production-grade machine learning systems. Your mission is to transform prototypes into robust, scalable solutions that deliver business value across ICA.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include:
   

  

* Designing and maintaining data pipelines and ML infrastructure in GCP.
* Automating model training, evaluation, deployment, and monitoring.
* Supporting teams with technical challenges and cost optimization in cloud environments.
* Driving best practices in MLOps and contributing to strategic AI initiatives.


**Who are we looking for?**
 We’re looking for someone with:
   

  

* A Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field.
* Strong programming skills in Python and experience with ML frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn).
* Hands-on experience deploying ML models in production and MLOps tools and techniques (e.g. experiment tracking, model versioning, CI/CD pipelines).
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (GCP preferred), BigQuery, Docker, Terraform, and SQL.
* Fluency in English is required. Swedish is a plus.


 You are a pragmatic problem solver, a strong team player, and thrive in a collaborative environment. You enjoy mentoring others and are motivated by building reliable, scalable systems.
   

  

**Why ICA?**
 ICA Sverige offers a unique opportunity to work with one of Sweden’s largest datasets and to shape the future of AI in retail. You’ll join a highly skilled and supportive team, working on impactful projects like autonomous AI agents and recommendation engines.
   

  

 Read more about life at ICA here.
   

  

**Apply now**
 If you have any kind of questions about the position contact hiring manager Ola Ottosson, Head of Data Science and Al, +46733 91 88 33, questions about the selection process or terms & conditions at ICA please contact recruiter Klara Himmelstrand, +4673 866 73 81. Apply as soon as possible, but no later than 2025-10-05.
   

  

 We are supposed to mirror our customers as well as society and require employees with different competences. We strive to recruit people with different backgrounds and value knowledge and experience that brings in. We value good conditions for a sustainable work life by having a good working environment and possibilities for constant evolution. If roles require it, you will need to undergo tests, background checks and drug testing before employment.
